etymology.description: 介(介) (jiè, "to mediate; intermediate") + 绍(紹) (shào, "to continue; to connect") = action of mediating and connecting -> introducing
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 介(介) (jiè, "to mediate; intermediate") and 绍(紹) (shào, "to continue; to connect") represents the idea of serving as an intermediary to connect people or ideas, which is the essence of introducing someone or something.

examples.chinese: 我介绍一下(我介紹一下)。
我介绍我的朋友(我介紹我的朋友)，你就听他的(你就聽他的)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jièshào wǒ de péngyǒu, nǐ jiù tīng tā de.
examples.english: I introduce my friend, then you can listen to him.

examples.chinese: 老师给我们介绍历史(老師給我們介紹歷史)，让我们了解过去(讓我們了解過去)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī gěi wǒmen jièshào lìshǐ, ràng wǒmen liǎojiě guòqù.
examples.english: The teacher introduces history to us, letting us understand the past.
